TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit Exec extends Microsoft.Build.Tasks.ToolTaskExtension

Docs.summary: Implements the Exec task. Use the Exec element in your project file to create and execute this task. For usage and parameter information, see [Exec Task](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/c9b7525a-b1c9-40fc-8bce-77a5b8f960d8).

Attribute.AttributeName: Microsoft.Build.Framework.Output

Docs.summary:
Returns the output as an Item. White space is trimmed.
ConsoleOutput is enabled when ConsoleToMSBuild is true. This avoids holding lines in memory if they aren't used. ConsoleOutput is a combination of stdout and stderr.

Docs.summary: Enable the standard output to pipe to an item. (StandardOutput).

MemberSignature.Value: protected override int ExecuteTool (string pathToTool, string responseFileCommands, string commandLineCommands);
.method familyhidebysig virtual instance int32 ExecuteTool(string pathToTool, string responseFileCommands, string commandLineCommands) cil managed
Protected Overrides Function ExecuteTool (pathToTool As String, responseFileCommands As String, commandLineCommands As String) As Integer
protected: override int ExecuteTool(System::String ^ pathToTool, System::String ^ responseFileCommands, System::String ^ commandLineCommands);
override this.ExecuteTool : string * string * string -> int

Docs.param: The path to the tool to execute.
Command line arguments that should go into a temporary response file.
Command line arguments that should be passed to the tool directly.
Docs.summary: Executes the cmd.exe tool, waits for its completion, and cleans up the batch file after execution completes.
Docs.returns: The exit code that the tool returns.

remarks.format: ## Remarks If errors were logged and the tool has an exit code of zero, then this method sets the exit code to -1.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a Boolean value that indicates whether to ignore the standard error and warning format and log errors and warnings from the output as regular messages.
Docs.value: if the Exec task should ignore the standard error and warning format and should log errors and warnings as regular messages; if the Exec task should log the errors and warnings that match the standard error and warning format.

Docs.summary: Logs the specified single line of text as an error or warning if the single line matched custom or standard error and warning formats or as a regular message if is set to and no custom format matched.

set: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the output items from the task.
Docs.value: The output items from the task.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The `Exec` task does not set the output items. Instead, you can provide the output items as if they were set by the task, so that they can be used later in the project.
